title: How to Fix a Curling Rug

steps.headline: Purchase four small, flat weights from a fishing, sports, or craft store.
Stitch each small weight into the underside of each corner of the rug.
steps.description: This will cause the rug to sit flat and stop curling. To prevent the weights from rubbing on the floor, try to stitch into a corner flap, or stitch a fabric flap over each weight.

steps.headline: If you are having a problem with the rug showing folds or popped-up portions, flatten these by adding a strip of felt underneath the rug.
steps.description: Simply stitch it into place and the stretch will undo the fold or bubble.

text: Purchase four small, flat weights from a fishing, sports, or craft store.  Stitch each small weight into the underside of each corner of the rug. This will cause the rug to sit flat and stop curling. To prevent the weights from rubbing on the floor, try to stitch into a corner flap, or stitch a fabric flap over each weight. If you are having a problem with the rug showing folds or popped-up portions, flatten these by adding a strip of felt underneath the rug. Simply stitch it into place and the stretch will undo the fold or bubble.
